revised_title: Time-Harmonic Elastodynamic Green's Function for Anisotropic Solids
tldr: The authors present a method using the Radon transform to determine the displacement field in an anisotropic solid due to a time-harmonic point force. The method reduces the system of coupled partial differential equations to a system of uncoupled 1-D Helmholtz equations, which can be solved easily. The resulting displacements are a summation of a regular elastodynamic term and a singular static term, both integrals over a unit sphere. This method allows for an efficient and relatively simple calculation of time-harmonic Green's functions for general anisotropic solids.
